headline: Devon Energy and Coterra Energy to Combine, Creating a Premier Shale Operator
summary: OKLAHOMA CITY & HOUSTON, February 02, 2026--Devon Energy ("Devon") (NYSE: DVN) and Coterra Energy ("Coterra") (NYSE: CTRA) today announced the signing of a definitive agreement to merge in an all-stock transaction. The combination will create a leading large-cap shale operator with a high-quality asset base anchored by a premier position in the economic core of the Delaware Basin.

content.title: Devon Energy and Coterra Energy to Combine, Creating a Premier Shale Operator
content.summary: OKLAHOMA CITY & HOUSTON, February 02, 2026--Devon Energy ("Devon") (NYSE: DVN) and Coterra Energy ("Coterra") (NYSE: CTRA) today announced the signing of a definitive agreement to merge in an all-stock transaction. The combination will create a leading large-cap shale operator with a high-quality asset base anchored by a premier position in the economic core of the Delaware Basin.

headline: Devon Energy and Coterra $58 Billion Merger Creates ‘Premiere Shale Operator’
summary: Devon Energy  and  Coterra Energy  the natural gas and oil exploration companies, plan to merge in a roughly $58 billion all-stock transaction.  Under the terms of the deal,  Coterra  shareholders will receive 0.7 Devon shares for each Coterra share they hold.  The combined enterprise value of $58 billion, which includes debt, is based on Devon’s closing price of $40.21 on Friday.

content.title: Devon Energy and Coterra $58 Billion Merger Creates ‘Premiere Shale Operator’
content.summary: Devon Energy  and  Coterra Energy  the natural gas and oil exploration companies, plan to merge in a roughly $58 billion all-stock transaction.  Under the terms of the deal,  Coterra  shareholders will receive 0.7 Devon shares for each Coterra share they hold.  The combined enterprise value of $58 billion, which includes debt, is based on Devon’s closing price of $40.21 on Friday.

headline: Devon Agrees to Buy Oil Rival Coterra for $21.4 Billion in Stock
summary: The deal calls for Coterra stockholders to receive 0.7 Devon shares for each share they own, according to a statement Monday.  The company will keep the Devon name, and Devon Chief Executive Officer Clay Gaspar will remain as CEO after the deal closes.  Bloomberg News first reported the talks earlier this year and revealed last week that a deal was near.

content.title: Devon Agrees to Buy Oil Rival Coterra for $21.4 Billion in Stock
content.summary: The deal calls for Coterra stockholders to receive 0.7 Devon shares for each share they own, according to a statement Monday.  The company will keep the Devon name, and Devon Chief Executive Officer Clay Gaspar will remain as CEO after the deal closes.  Bloomberg News first reported the talks earlier this year and revealed last week that a deal was near.

headline: Oracle to raise $50B for AI, Devon–Coterra deal, crypto stocks fall
summary: Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to take a look at some of Monday morning's trending tickers and stories. Devon Energy Corporation (DVN) will acquire Coterra (CTRA) in an all-stock deal. Oracle (ORCL) said it would raise $50 billion for its artificial intelligence (AI) build-out.   Crypto stocks, including Strategy (MSTR), Coinbase (COIN), and Robinhood (HOOD), are all trading lower. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: Oracle to raise $50B for AI, Devon–Coterra deal, crypto stocks fall
content.description:
Yahoo Finance Markets and Data Editor Jared Blikre joins Morning Brief host Julie Hyman to take a look at some of Monday morning's trending tickers and stories.

Devon Energy Corporation (DVN) will acquire Coterra (CTRA) in an all-stock deal.

Oracle (ORCL) said it would raise $50 billion for its artificial intelligence (AI) build-out.  

Crypto stocks, including Strategy (MSTR), Coinbase (COIN), and Robinhood (HOOD), are all trading lower.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

Oracle (ORCL) said it would raise $50 billion for its artificial intelligence (AI) build-out.   Crypto stocks, including Strategy (MSTR), Coinbase (COIN), and Robinhood (HOOD), are all trading lower. headline: Coterra And Devon Merger Reshapes Shale Outlook And Valuation Case
summary: Coterra Energy (NYSE:CTRA) and Devon Energy agreed to a US$58b all stock merger. The combined company will be headquartered in Houston and positioned as a large U.S. shale producer. The deal brings together assets in regions including the Delaware Basin under a single operator. Coterra Energy, an independent oil and gas producer, already has a footprint across key U.S. shale basins, and this merger with Devon expands that reach further. For investors, the tie up comes at a time when scale,...

headline: Devon Agrees to Buy US Shale Rival Coterra for $21.4 Billion
summary: The deal calls for Coterra stockholders to receive 0.7 Devon shares for each share they own, according to a statement Monday.  Coterra’s shares fell Monday as much as 4.6% for the biggest intraday drop in almost a month, while Devon slipped as much as 2.6%.  The combination would strengthen their positions in the Delaware Basin, a fast-growing swath of the country’s largest and most productive oil field, the Permian Basin of West Texas and New Mexico.

content.title: Devon Agrees to Buy US Shale Rival Coterra for $21.4 Billion
content.summary: The deal calls for Coterra stockholders to receive 0.7 Devon shares for each share they own, according to a statement Monday.  Coterra’s shares fell Monday as much as 4.6% for the biggest intraday drop in almost a month, while Devon slipped as much as 2.6%.  The combination would strengthen their positions in the Delaware Basin, a fast-growing swath of the country’s largest and most productive oil field, the Permian Basin of West Texas and New Mexico.

headline: A $58 Billion Shale Merger Comes at an Awkward Time
summary: Oil and gas producers  Devon Energy  and  Coterra Energy  are joining forces to become a dominant $58 billion shale-drilling company that will rank among the top players in U.S.-based production.  Analysts seem to like the deal, but shares of both Devon and  Coterra  were down 0.5% and 3%, respectively, early on Monday.  Part of the problem was that oil prices were falling Monday.

content.title: A $58 Billion Shale Merger Comes at an Awkward Time
content.summary: Oil and gas producers  Devon Energy  and  Coterra Energy  are joining forces to become a dominant $58 billion shale-drilling company that will rank among the top players in U.S.-based production.  Analysts seem to like the deal, but shares of both Devon and  Coterra  were down 0.5% and 3%, respectively, early on Monday.  Part of the problem was that oil prices were falling Monday.

headline: Devon And Coterra Merge To Build Scaled Delaware Basin Shale Operator
summary: Devon Energy and Coterra Energy have agreed to merge in an all stock deal. The combined company is set to become a leading shale operator with a prime position in the Delaware Basin. The transaction is expected to reshape scale, capital allocation, and portfolio focus for both businesses. Devon Energy, trading on the NYSE under ticker NYSE:DVN, comes into this merger with a share price of $40.21 and a 1 year return of 22.5%. Over 5 years, the stock shows a 177.9% return, while the 3 year...

headline: Assessing Coterra Energy (CTRA) Valuation After Recent Share Price Momentum And Long Term Returns
summary: Why Coterra Energy Is On Investors’ Radar Coterra Energy (CTRA) has caught fresh attention after a period of steady trading, with recent returns over the past month and past 3 months prompting investors to reassess the stock’s risk and reward profile. The company, headquartered in Houston, operates across key U.S. basins with revenue of US$6,666 million and net income of US$1,646 million. This provides investors with concrete scale and profitability figures to consider. See our latest...
